metadata.title: CVE-2019-5798 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Lack of correct bounds checking in Skia in Google Chrome prior to73.0.3683.75 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memoryread via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0.3683.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
